reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 551/21: THERMAL TREATMENT SITE EXEMPTION

content.content: 1. In this Regulation, “tire waste” means, (a)  used tires within the meaning of Ontario Regulation 390/16 (Used Tires) made under the Waste Diversion Transition Act, 2016, (b)  shredded and chipped tires, and (c)  crumb rubber recovered from used tires or shredded or chipped tires.
content.raw_html:
1. In this Regulation,

“tire waste” means,

(a)  used tires within the meaning of Ontario Regulation 390/16 (Used Tires) made under the Waste Diversion Transition Act, 2016,

(b)  shredded and chipped tires, and

(c)  crumb rubber recovered from used tires or shredded or chipped tires.

content.content: 2. The establishing or changing of a thermal treatment site at the location described in section 3 is exempt from the Act as long as, (a)  the site does not use coal, oil or petroleum coke as a fuel for thermal treatment; (b)  the waste that is subject to thermal treatment is tire waste; and (c)  the amount of tire waste that is subject to thermal treatment on any day, measured by weight, is no more than 20 tonnes.
content.raw_html:
2. The establishing or changing of a thermal treatment site at the location described in section 3 is exempt from the Act as long as,

(a)  the site does not use coal, oil or petroleum coke as a fuel for thermal treatment;

(b)  the waste that is subject to thermal treatment is tire waste; and

(c)  the amount of tire waste that is subject to thermal treatment on any day, measured by weight, is no more than 20 tonnes.

content.content: 3. The location of the thermal treatment site referred to in section 2 is the land described as Part of Section 34, Korah, Part 1 on Plan 1R11773, City of Sault Ste Marie, being all of Property Identification Number 31609 0367 in the Land Titles Division of Algoma (No. 1).
